result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward C Brenton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Work Release .  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court. 
------------------------------------------

Two (2) days dead time credit if probation is revoked. 
------------------------------------------

miscConds.notes:
Pay $200 fine plus court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without victim's and Probation agent consent. 
------------------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Edward C Brenton in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Edward C Brenton. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court. Victim K.B. makes statement to court and addresses defendant. Court thanks victim for her statement. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant makes statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Minutes filed.

Defendant Edward C Brenton in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Edward C Brenton. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Edward C Brenton not in court, Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen not in court. Letter to adjourn on file. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH K.M.B. (dob 9/15/1987).  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
